result.execSummary:
The defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served.
May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent.

miscConds.notes:
*   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
*   Restitution is set at $0.00.
*   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or combination of both.
Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

*   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
*   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
*   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 6 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 12 MONTHS. May terminate probation after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant NOT possess or
          use any controlled substances unless by valid prescription.
     *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with Brianna S.
     *   Pay all mandatory costs and surcharges by the end of
          probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
     *   Obtain and maintain (full-time) employment, school, or
          combination of both.
     *   Restitution is set at $0.00.

Upon successful completion of the sentence Court will allow for expungement.

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit,received and filed

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jury trial scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant awaiting a TAD evaluation.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for projected guilty plea.  Statements by defense counsel that defendant still needs to be TAD evaluated.  Defense requests an adjourned plea date.  State has no objection.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense seeking DPA resolution.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services "Court Reminders."    The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with Brianna S.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  LM   
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($350.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 350.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Student Intern Arial Rosenberg under the supervision of Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for jury trial.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Final Pretrial. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date. Court ordered case remain set for Jury Trial on 11/02/2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for DPA Hearing. At request of defense counsel matter is set for a Final Pretrial & Jury Trial date in branch 23. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for DPA Hearing. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Branch 45.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with co-defendant Brianna Schliepp.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Beasan Mohammad Shkoukani in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
